{"step_by_step_thinking": "The occlusal surface of a tooth is the part that comes into contact with the opposing tooth when the mouth is closed. A single central pit is a characteristic feature of the occlusal surface of certain teeth. The lower 1st premolar typically has two pits, while the upper 1st premolar usually has one or two pits. The lower 2nd premolar typically has three pits, while the upper 2nd premolar usually has a single central pit.", "answer_choice": "D. Upper 2nd premolar"}
